obs.ontologyAccess
Class UmlsAccessTool

java.lang.Object
  obs.ontologyAccess.AbstractOntologyAccessTool
      obs.ontologyAccess.UmlsAccessTool
All Implemented Interfaces:
OntologyAccess
public class UmlsAccessTool
extends AbstractOntologyAccessTool

This class is used to access UMLS ontologies. This tool needs a release of UMLS installed on a MySQL database server. It works with the [2007AC] version of UMLS. Other versions have not been tested.
See also OntologyAccess, AbstractOntologyAccessTool.
ParametersBean to connect to the MySQL server should be in a String[3] array such as: {"jdbc:mysql://ncbo-db2.stanford.edu:3306/umls","ontrez","ontrez"}
Accessing ontologies can be restricted by UMLS semantic types. Semantic types are accessed with TUIs as they appear in the MRSTY table, later called localSemanticTypeID. A tool has a set of semantic types (i.e., TUI Strings) that may be null. This set of semantic types is used as a restriction on certain queries.
Remark: The tool only deal with english-based ontologies i.e., all query to the DB tables MRCONSO & MRSAB are restricted by LAT = 'ENG'.
Remark: The tool only deal with isa hierarchies i.e., all query to the DB table MRHIER & MRSAB are restricted by MRHIER.RELA='isa' OR MRHIER.RELA IS NULL.
The creation of a UmlsAccessTool open a set of prepared statements that are used by the tool to execute the queries. These prepared statements are closed (as well as the connection to the DB) when the tool is destructed.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Clement Jonquet, Nipun Bathia, Nigam Shah

Constructor Detail

UmlsAccessTool

public UmlsAccessTool(java.lang.String[] connParameters,
                      java.lang.String name)
Constructs a tool given a specific array of String parameters for connecting to the UMLS MySQL database. The connection parameters are [database server address, username, password]. For more details, see also JDBC driver documentation. The new UmlsAccessTool is constructed with an empty set of ontologies and a name. The tool set of restricted semantic types is also null i.e., the tool accesses all the semantic type in UMLS (no restriction at all)

UmlsAccessTool

public UmlsAccessTool(java.lang.String[] localOntologyIDs,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String[] connectionParameters,
                      java.lang.String[] localSemanticTypeIDs)
               throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException,
                      UmlsAccessTool.NonValidLocalSemanticTypeIDException
Constructs a tool given a specific array of String parameters for connecting to the UMLS MySQL database, an array of ontologies (i.e., UMLS SABs), a customized generated name and an array of semantic types to be restricted to (i.e., UMLS TUIs).

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException
UmlsAccessTool.NonValidLocalSemanticTypeIDException

getConceptPreferredName

public java.lang.String getConceptPreferredName(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                         throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
For a given concept, returns the preferred name of the concept. Remark: In UMLS, preferred name are for CUIs. It means that a concept restricted to a specific ontology (i.e., localConceptID) may not have any preferred name because the UMLS preferred name for the corresponding CUI is not in the restricted ontology. In that case, this function returns the first result of the following SQL query: SELECT DISTINCT STR FROM MRCONSO WHERE cui = 'C0025202' AND sab = 'SNOMEDCT' AND lat = 'ENG' ORDER BY lower(ts), lui, stt, sui, ispref desc LIMIT 1;

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptSynonyms

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getConceptSynonyms(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                       throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
For a given concept, returns a set of String, synonym names of the concept. Returns the rest of the results of the query done by the getPreferredName function (without the LIMIT 1).

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptMappings

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String[]> getConceptMappings(java.lang.String localConceptID,
                                                                java.lang.String localOntologyID)
                                                         throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException,
                                                                OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException

getConceptMappingsUMLS

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String[]> getConceptMappingsUMLS(java.lang.String localConceptID,
                                                                    java.lang.String localOntologyID,
                                                                    boolean filter)
                                                             throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException,
                                                                    OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException
Returns a set of couples [mappedLocalConceptID, mappingType] saying that the given concept is mapped to (according to mappingType) mappedLocalConceptID in the given ontology. The given ontology can be the one in which the given concept is defined (internal mappings). Mappings come both from inter-CUI-mappings (i.e., concepts in other ontologies with the same CUI are considered mapped - mappingType='inter-cui') and form MRREL table with REL='RL' OR (REL='RO' AND RELA IN ('default_mapped_to', 'mapped_to', 'multiply_mapped_to', 'other_mapped_to', 'primary_mapped_to', 'uniquely_mapped_to')). Mappings from MRREL are not considered tranistive.

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException

isValidLocalConceptID

public boolean isValidLocalConceptID(java.lang.String localConceptID)
LocalConceptID must match the following regular expression: [\\p{Upper}\\d]+/C\\d{7} For instance: MSH/C0000039. This function do check if the SAB part of the localConceptID is a valid SAB using isValidLocalOntologyID.

createLocalConceptID

public java.lang.String createLocalConceptID(java.lang.String localOntologyID,
                                             java.lang.String cui)
Creates a localConceptID with a given ontology (i.e., UMLS SAB) and UMLS CUI. LocalConceptID form is: 'SAB/CUI'.

isValidLocalOntologyID

public boolean isValidLocalOntologyID(java.lang.String localOntologyID)
LocalOntologyID must match the following regular expression: [\\p{Upper}\\d_\\.-]+ For instance: MSH or ICPC2EENG. This function checks also with UMLS if the given localOntologyID is a valid SAB in UMLS.

isValidLocalSemanticTypeID

public boolean isValidLocalSemanticTypeID(java.lang.String localSemanticTypeID)
LocalSemanticTypeID must match the following regular expression: T\\d{3} For instance: T116. This function checks also with UMLS if the given localSemanticID is a valid TUI in UMLS.

                                                                      java.lang.String localOntologyID,
                                                                      boolean exactMap)
                                                               throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException

OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException

mapStringToLocalConceptIDsUMLS

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> mapStringToLocalConceptIDsUMLS(java.lang.String s,
                                                                          java.lang.String localOntologyID,
                                                                          boolean exactMap,
                                                                          boolean filter)
                                                                   throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException
For a given String, returns the set of concepts for which the given String is exactly equal to one of the concept names in the given ontology by filtering or not to the tool semantic types, according to the given flag.

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException

mapStringToLocalConceptIDs

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> mapStringToLocalConceptIDs(java.lang.String s,
                                                                      boolean exactMap)
For a given String, returns the set of concepts in all the ontologies accessed by the tool for which the given String is (i) exactly equal to one of the concept names if the flag is true; (ii) contained into one of the concept names if the flag is false; Overrided for better performance, because it can be done with one SQL query. Equivalent to mapStringToLocalConceptIDs(s, exactMap, true).

Overrides:
mapStringToLocalConceptIDs in class AbstractOntologyAccessTool

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> mapStringToLocalConceptIDsUMLS(java.lang.String s,
                                                                          boolean exactMap,
                                                                          boolean filter)
For a given String, returns the set of concept for which the given String is exactly equal to one of the concept names in all the ontologies accessed by the tool by filtering or not to the tool semantic types, according to the given flag.

getConceptParents

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getConceptParents(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                                          throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
Equivalent to getConceptParentsWithAUIs(localConceptID, false).

Specified by:
getConceptParents in interface OntologyAccess
Overrides:
getConceptParents in class AbstractOntologyAccessTool
Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptParentsWithCUIs

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getConceptParentsWithCUIs(java.lang.String localConceptID,
                                                                                         boolean filter)
                                                                                  throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
This function implements a recursive manner to get the parents. This function returns all the parent concepts based on the CUI information in UMLS, not the AUI one. Equivalent to super.getConceptParents(localConceptID) + filtering.

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptParentsWithAUIs

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getConceptParentsWithAUIs(java.lang.String localConceptID,
                                                                                         boolean filter)
                                                                                  throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
For a given concept, returns a hashtable that represents the set of concepts of all the parents (recursively to the ontology root) by filtering or not to the tool semantic types, according to the given flag. When a parent that has another semantic type than the one the tool manipulates is found, then it is not added to the table, but the recursion go through it. Uses the PTR information from the table MRHIER. Note the last concept in the PTR is not returned, because it identifies the ontology itself. Cycles are not removed, only shortest distance are kept.

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getConceptChildren(java.lang.String localConceptID)

getConceptChildrenWithCUIs

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getConceptChildrenWithCUIs(java.lang.String localConceptID,
                                                                                          boolean filter)
                                                                                   throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
This function implements a recursive manner to get the children. This function returns all the children concepts based on the CUI information in UMLS, not the AUI one. Equivalent to super.getConceptChildren(localConceptID) + filtering.

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptChildrenWithAUIs

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getConceptChildrenWithAUIs(java.lang.String localConceptID,
                                                                                          boolean filter)
                                                                                   throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
For a given concept, returns a hashtable that represents the set of concepts of all the children (recursively to the ontology leaves) by filtering or not to the tool semantic types, according to the given flag. When a child that has another semantic type than the one the tool manipulates is found, then it is not added to the table, but the recursion go through it.

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptPtrs

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getConceptPtrs(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                   throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
Returns a set of path to the roots (PTRs) for a given concept. PTRs are represented as a list of localConceptIDs, separated by periods (.) The first one in the list is top of the hierarchy; the last one in the list is the direct parent of the concept. Equivalent to getConceptPtrsWithAUIs(localConceptID).

Specified by:
getConceptPtrs in class AbstractOntologyAccessTool
Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptPtls

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getConceptPtls(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                   throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
Returns a set of path to the leaves (PTLs) for a given concept. PTLs are represented as a list of localConceptIDs, separated by periods (.) The first one in the list is the leaf in the hierarchy; the last one in the list is the direct child of the concept. Equivalent to getConceptPtlsFromAuiPtrs(localConceptID).

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptPtrsWithCUIs

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getConceptPtrsWithCUIs(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                           throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
PTRs are recursively computed based on the MRHIER direct parent information. NOT IMPLEMENTED.

getConceptPtrsWithAUIs

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getConceptPtrsWithAUIs(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                           throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
PTRs are selected in MRHIER and then transformed with localConceptIDs. Cycles that may appen by going from AUI to localConceptID are not removed.

getConceptPtlsFromAuiPtrs

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getConceptPtlsFromAuiPtrs(java.lang.String localConceptID,
                                                                     boolean filter,
                                                                     java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> ontologyLeaves)
                                                              throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
PTLs are reconstructed (and then transformed with localConceptIDs) thanks to the PTRs selected in MRHIER. The given set of leave is used in the recontsruction.

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptPtlsFromAuiPtrs

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getConceptPtlsFromAuiPtrs(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                              throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
PTLs are reconstructed (and then transformed with localConceptIDs) thanks to the PTRs selected in MRHIER. The given set of leave necessary is computed and then getConceptPtlsFromAuiPtrs is called.
